Posts.Content: Happy Cancerversary to you. I know it has to feel wonderful.

I am 46 started chemo treatments when I was 45. My period stopped after my second chemo treatment and has not returned yet. I am still premenopausal and just waiting, like you not sure how I feel yet at this point I am not missing having my period just afraid that it might show up one day very unexpectedly.
Posts.Title: Menstruation and Chemo

Posts.Content: I love my port, made treatments very easy, blood draws were nice through the port also, only one stick instead of two.

Posts.Title: Please just say a little prayer....

Posts.Content: As a newbie to the site and discussion board I wanted to share this poem that I had written some time ago with all my sisters who are breast cancer survivors. I thought that this poem was very appropriate considering all the love that I have seen written in the posts on the discussion boards. I hope that you all enjoy reading it. Love of a Friend Sometimes sisters are born to the Same family Learning to love, speak and act In much the same ways Sometimes sisters are brought together By God God knew from the start that we would One day need each other Be part of each other’s lives He brought us through many of the same Circumstances and adversities Then He brought us together To stand by each other, to lean on To learn from and to love There is no greater love between friends Than the love of friends Who become sisters I love you My sister and My friend by beetle25(PC)
Posts.Title: Love of a Friend - a poem for all my wonderful sisters out there
